chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:38 PM Defendant Thomas Earl Bartelme in court.  Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court for Thomas Earl Bartelme.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Schiek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 03:39 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM  Defendant Thomas Earl Bartelme in court.  Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court for Thomas Earl Bartelme.  Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. States calls Det/Sgt Hebein sworn/direct. Record reflects witnesses identification of defendant. Cross/redirect.  Atty Cirilli statement.  Court statement -finds probable cause exits and binds over.  Atty Sowinski statement regarding filing Information and that it will mirror complaint.  Atty Cirilli would like arraignment set over for different date and waives time limits.  Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm. Bond continued.  adj: 11:43 am.

and $8,000 signature bond to be signed by mother - $20,000 total. Court verifies address of mother and Defendant. Court modifies bond. adj. 01:38 PM
